one_reviews_text: Very limited tour of body.  Should be called The Cell!

This was pretty awesome but the drawbacks are there.  You start off in the bloodstream and it tells you about the white cells, red cells and 2 others.  Then it shrinks down and you go into a tear in the vein wall and thats when I started to not follow what they were talking about because it got dense.  There is a lot of biology and terms and explainations of what things *do* but thats a bit to the fault of this thing because I had questions.

I love this thing, I think its an amazing tool for this kind of thing but the two things I did not like where that i didn't feel any perspective was given into more general information on how these fit into the whole.  The other thing was the developers had to make a choice to make this world and they had to use graphical representations of the things themselves...  Like cell walls and things that look like candy sticks.  I think they did a good job with what they had but it also didn't feel "real" if you follow but for like a less than 500meg download, its pretty freaking amazing and worth the trip.

I do love this and what they did here.

I was hoping for more.. well... everything. A lot of the textures were pretty bad, like two generations ago kind of bad. Things were clipping through each other, like the molecules clipping through the pumps leading into the cell. There was really not enough information on anything, you basically got the name of each thing you saw and an extremely basic description. There was only one pump. it did not describe any of the other types such as the sodium-ion gated channel. I think the previous sentence describes the entire experience. You went through this macrophage and the only thing described briefly were the Nucleus and Mitochondria. The virus attack simply phased right through the cell. Although this was very poorly done, I still appreciate it and believe that VR is the future to learning. Things are much easier to learn when you are actually there instead of trying to create an image in your head.
Very bad - only English
This is the future of education, but this game is a bit lackluster in graphics. Still this is a glimpse into the future of education & for that I give it a 4 star

You go inside the human body, specifically inside the vascular system and inside blood, cells, and other related organisms.  There are no explosions, no gun fights, no rollercoaster simulations, no gameplay mechanics.  There's no drama, no plot, no character development.  Because it's all about the science and  a peek into the human body.  My only criticism is that certain concepts are introduced, but not explained.  For example, the term "protein synthesis" is used to describe some of the functions but never defined.  DNA is defined, but never explained in detail.  This experience kind of assumes you are already familiar with many of these concepts and just want a VR microscopic view of these systems.  It's a great aid to be used alongside a teaching tool, but not great as a teaching tool itself.  It's a missed opportunity to teach people some basic, but not widely known by a majority of adults, concepts in biology.
Nice easy graphic, basic guide through bood system, I miss little more interactive with parts of blood
Game never started, click start...CRASH
wont load. instantly crashes.
bloody awful con tinuos load mode

review_title: Cool but not ready for VR
one_reviews_text: It's interesting to see, but it's more of a 360° 3D experience than a VR experience. The camera jumps abruptly and you can't interact with anything, it's just a long 3D documentary. It's pretty and interesting! But not a good VR experience.
The possibilities are definitely there but excecution is lackluster. It's still easy to see that this is a great format for a documentary but the graphics and uneventfulness makes it fall short.

This VR experience is short but really well made. The animations a lot more comprehensive compared to many other cell video's on youtube. Considering it's free it definitely is worth downloading and experiencing.

It's a really cool idea, and I found the facts very interesting; however, the mechanics are nausiating. The transitions between movements are very sharp: first heading full speed towards a cell wall, and then stopping completely just before hitting it is not a good feeling. 

As for the "Story", all the chapters seem to lead into each other, but the last one feels like a very abrupt ending.
Great way to study would love to see more.
The app is not starting it is crashing all time from the very first time.
what took me 7 years to under tand i understad it in that amount in time

review_title: Nice app, but may be better
one_reviews_text: Only blood and cell.. Iam hope for more..

What better way to learn about something than being up close and personal with the thing you are learning about? I'm a High School student, and I would love going to school if this is the kind of thing we got to do/watch.

This app shines as one of the very first VR educational experiences. The content is aimed at middle/high school cellular biology. It's made exciting through the use of narrative (especially the part about viruses), although I would appreciate more interactivity. I would love to see future content made in this style.

review_title: Informative and a great visual aid.
one_reviews_text: Very well done.  Wish there was more.  Would really love a Magic School Bus style trip through the different systems.  Also, anatomy and phisiology lessons would be cool as well.  Seeing the vascular and neural systems in VR would be a sight!
It's really a great APP. The 3D models have great details. The vocal introduction is good. What's more, CHS is available in the language menu.

review_title: Very nice but not so interactive
one_reviews_text: I would welcome if there was possibility to move around freely and navigate within the tiny shuttle. Also i would pay for a version that's translated into Czech or Slovak language.
Please please please make more like on the systems like the GI, heart, Resp and disease processes ect please!!
This is not a game but an educational experience. Not mind blowing but a good free experience to be had.

As a showcase for the future of education this is a great little app. Immersive learning and I'd absolutely pay for a more detailed version for different systems of the body - particularly if they were aligned with school learning objectives for various ages.
It's also a good introduction for people who have never seen VR anything as no controls are required. Sit back and enjoy.
Should have been called "Human Red Blood Cell VR"  as that's really all it toured me through.  Needs more content to be worth keeping on my PC.
Nice short VR experience
The program shows the first tall red thing then goes to a wait ourglass that never finishes.
It was pretty entertaining for it's duration, the kind of app you check out once and are entertained but never look at again or have any desire show anyone. I think it just needs more content.
An attempt at educational VR.  Not the most successful to date, but interesting to experience... once.

review_title: Nice brief tour of the cell
one_reviews_text: This is an admirable project, and with some refinements would be a terrific introduction to the very basics of cell structure.
loved the show Ozzy & Drix, well here you go fam!
